page.title: 02HISTORY - ETTRICK VALLEY
page.content: Ettrick Valley Deer Walk Thirlestane to Tushielaw With the lands of Ramseycleuch behind we make our way northwards passing the site of Thirlestane Mill, now Thirlestane Gardens. On the east side of the Ettrick is Gamescleugh, the hill land clad with trees, the remains of Simon Longspear's Tower brooding near the burn. On top of Wardlaw stands the Jubilee Cairn erected to commemorate Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee in l887. In the 'Thirlestane Policies' stand the remains of the ancient tower of Thirlestane but the l8th century mansion house has been demolished.Of the two lodges leading to Thirlestane House only the east lodge remains. Much of the valley land used to belong to Thirlestane estate.
